Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: Terrific!  You should feel insignificant!

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: YES!!!  You know, people ask me, "Doctor, why are you always happy?" And I tell them it's mind over matter.  I don't mind that I don't matter!  Do you get it?  Do you get it?

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: Z, we're part of the fastest growing species in the whole world!

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: Ask me why we're so successful.

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: I'm glad you asked me that question!

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: What do you see out there?

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: Right!  Ants!  Millions of creatures, each with his assigned task, all pulling together!

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: You see?  Being an ant is being able to say, "Hey -- I'm meaningless, you're meaningless."

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: Z...you need help.  Whoops!  We're gonna have to stop there.  Your minute is up!

Speaker: motivational counsellor
Dialogue: Now back to work!  We've made real progress!  Remember -- let's be best superorganism we can be!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Hello?!  Earth to Z!  You better snap out of it, or there's gonna be a lot of pissed off ants!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: SHUT UP!!!  It's bad enough there's a food shortage without you complaining about it every day.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: No, Z.  The squeaky wheel gets thrown away, alright?  You're a good ant, Z, even though you are a pain in my rear- segment.  I don't wanna see anything happen to you.  So quit mouthing off, before you get in trouble.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Break's over.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Who cares, Z.  All I know is, we gotta dig.  We're not the ones in charge.

Speaker: general formica
Dialogue: STAIRS!

Speaker: general formica
Dialogue: Cut the chit-chat down there!  We've spoiled these workers, Carpenter.  They've never had it so good, and listen to them -- always grumbling and complaining...

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: ...Yes, sir.

Speaker: general formica
Dialogue: What have they got to complain about? Three square meals a day...

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Actually, sir, we've cut them down to three roughly rectangular meals a week.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Don't give me statistics, Carpenter. I know what I'm talking about.  DOORS!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Oil that, soldier.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Ah!  General Formica.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: General, the severe food shortage that faces the colony...pains me. The thought of any of my children going hungry...  What steps are you taking to remedy the situation?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: We are launching a major offensive to expand our foraging territory...

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Yes, what else?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Please don't worry, your majesty. Leave the worrying to me.  As you know, I'm not an ant of half- measures.  I don't pussyfoot around. This crisis is my number one priority, and I promise you it's being dealt with swiftly, and decisively.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Now -- what were we saying?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: I do not recollect, your majesty. Will that be all?

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Yes, General Formica.  Carry on, my good man!  I don't know what we would do without you.

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Princess Bala, sir.  Your fiancee.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Princess!  You look -- outstanding. Is there anything I can do for you?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Well -- I thought -- since we're getting married...it might be nice if we...got to know one another.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Bala has always been a hopeless romantic, General.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: It's just that -- well, I'm honored that you selected me, and everything, I just thought the marriage might go a little more smoothly if -- we had a conversation?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Wasn't she briefed?

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Next!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: I'll take your suggestion under advisement, Princess.  In the meanwhile --

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: General -- we have to talk sometime!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Very well.  Carpenter, is there a convenient time to talk vis-a-vis: relationship?

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Actually, sir, we're ahead of schedule.  We have thirty-six seconds available right now.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Outstanding.  Princess...?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: So, um...how was your day?  What did you do?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: I declared war!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Oh...and I was afraid we had nothing in common...

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Fourteen-fifty hours, sir.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Duty calls!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: No squeak.  Outstanding!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: I felt the same way before I got married.  Confused.  Scared.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You did?

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Yes -- but I did my duty and sorted out all those messy feelings.  The wonderful thing about ant life is that everything is arranged.  Even marriage.  You're lucky -- General Formica is a paragon of anthood.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Yes...he's wonderful...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Wrong?  How could anything be wrong? I'm going to marry General Formica and be a queen and have millions of babies, just like my mom.  Do I look fat to you?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: The Club's so stuffy.  I want to try someplace different.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: The worker bar!  Yes!  That's where I want to go!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: I'll be back.

Speaker: aphids
Dialogue: Ouch!  Ouch!

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Two aphid beers.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about, Z.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Yeah, but you get to spend all day with those fabulous worker babes.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Who said there was a girl for you? I was talking about a girl for me.  Don't you want your aphid beer?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Z, we've known each other a long time, right?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: And all the time I've known you, you've been grumping and groaning. You should quit making waves.  Go with the flow.

Speaker: drunk scout
Dialogue: Have you been to Insectopia?  Have you?  No, ya goddam larvas!  But I have...  It's Insectopia!  Insectopia!

Speaker: drunk scout
Dialogue: I was cut off from my unit -- found it by mistake --  You see -- ya follow the great yellow egg, and you come to the land of red and white --

Speaker: soldiers
Dialogue: You've had enough for one night! Come on, Gramps, before you get in trouble.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Poor guy's had one too many scouting missions.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm the Princess, aren't I?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: And do Princesses do improper things?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Then if I go to the worker bar, it isn't improper.  Anyway, don't worry. No one will recognize us in our disguises.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm just a common worker, cooling off after a rough day!

Speaker: barker
Dialogue: Okay, folks.  It's six-fifteen, and that means it's time to dance.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Time to cut a rug, Z!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Well, you just sit here and be a party-pooper.

Speaker: barker
Dialogue: And a left-right-quarterstep-back step-halfstep -- a left-right- quarterstep-backstep-halfstep -- a left-right-quarterstep-backstep halfstep --

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm going to ask one of these mindless, primitive worker-types to dance with me!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Wanna dance?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I work in the palace, I don't get out much.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Are you sure this is a real dance?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You're right!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Why can't I just do whatever I want to do?  Why can't I just go wild?! Yahoo!

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Hey!  Watch your step, worker.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You watch yours, soldier, or my worker friend will beat you up!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Aren't you gonna stand up for yourself?

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: How come you don't dance like the rest of us?

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: You look like a worker to me.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Hey, lay off my little buddy!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Uh oh.  Goodbye!  Gotta run!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Let me think.  Hmmnn...  Never.  Bye!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Get real, Z!  She just dropped the scarf by accident!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: It's a sign that you're crazy!  Do you know what the penalty for impersonating a soldier is?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: I can't think of any.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Will you introduce me to some worker girls?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Maybe I'll get lucky.  You know, Z, I wouldn't do this for anyone but you...

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Wear this.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Yeah, I know.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Don't tell anyone you're a worker. Follow that column over there.  And come right back after the inspection!

Speaker: loud voice
Dialogue: ATTEN-SHUN!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: First of all, let me make one thing clear.  Nobody ever won a battle by thinking for himself.  All this "thinking" stuff is a load of crap. If the almighty had wanted you boys to think, he wouldn't have given you huge mandibles and a brain so small you'd misplace it if it wasn't trapped inside your head.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Hell, we're not an army of ants...we're one giant ant, with giant fists, and giant jaws!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Now I've heard a lot of scuttlebutt about a food shortage.  Well you boys are gonna be taken care of.  But in the meantime we're gonna eat the enemy for breakfast, we are gonna eat the enemy for lunch, and we are gonna eat the enemy for dinner!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: And I know each and every one of you boys will do your duty.  Dismissed.

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Stow the gab there, soldier!  Let's move 'em out!

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Eyes...left!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Who is that idiot?

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Darling, you must encourage the troops -- wave!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: You new, kid?

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Trial membership?  Kid, when you join this ant's army, you're in for the full hitch.

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Are you crazy, kid?  They shoot deserters!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: You just stick by old Barbatus. He'll watch out for you.  Whatsamatter, kid?  Leave a girl behind?

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: No -- we're going to attack the termites!

Speaker: ant soldiers
Dialogue: We ants go marching one by one, hurrah, hurrah!  We slaughter termites just for fun, Hurrah! Hurrah!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: No such luck.  Those dirty terms are five times bigger than us, and they shoot acid from their foreheads!

Speaker: soldier ants
Dialogue: We ants go marching two by two, hurrah!  Hurrah!  We'll all be dead before we're through, hurrah!  Hurrah!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Our platoon has the best assignment of all.  We're the first into battle!

Speaker: ant soldiers
Dialogue: We ants are marching three by three, hurrah!  Hurrah!  Dead ants is what we soon will be, hurrah!  Hurrah!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Superior numbers, kid!

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: ATTAAAAAAAAACK!!!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Over the TOOOOOOOOOOOOO-OP!!!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: It's too damn quiet.

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Don't be scared, kid.  Barbatus's got yer back.

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Light it up!

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: They're here!!!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Keep your head down!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Don't get all sappy about it!

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: I love the smell of formic acid in the morning.

Speaker: ant officer
Dialogue: He's killed their Queen!

Speaker: ant officer
Dialogue: VICTORY!!!

Speaker: ant officer
Dialogue: Let's slaughter them all!

Speaker: ant officer
Dialogue: INCOMING!

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Be honest, kid -- am I hurt bad?

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: No -- I can see it in your eyes.  I'm a goner.  It's alright, Z.  In this ant's army, a soldier's life ain't worth a sack of fungus.  I can't feel my legs...

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: I wonder...what...was it all...for...

Speaker: barbatus
Dialogue: Don't make my mistake, kid... don't...be a grunt...your whole life...

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Hey, slow it down, big boy.  You're making the rest of us look bad...How come I haven't seen you around here before?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: I'm new...I was born yesterday.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Tell me about it.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Nobody told me digging was so much fun!  You pick up the dirt, you move it, you pick it up again, you move it again -- lots of repetitions, you exercise the forceps, and the pincers --

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Mmm, yes, I see what you mean...

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: What's the holdup here?!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Sorry, sir -- I was just having a little chat with my friend --

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: Who said you could have a chat? You're not a chatter, you're a digger!  So shut up and dig!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Leave him alone!  He's new.

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: You  too?  Well just for that, you lose your day's rations!  Now get back to work!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: I don't know what came over me, talking back like that.  I must be going crazy...

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Sorry I got you in trouble.  But listen, you can share my rations.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Are you asking me out to dinner?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: No -- I mean yes -- I mean -- if you don't have other plans.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: I'll make myself available...Listen, better watch out with the backtalk.  I don't know want you to end up like the guy who used to work next to me.  I'm afraid he got... downsized.

Speaker: guard ant
Dialogue: Look!  They're back!  The army's back!  Alert the colony!

Speaker: excited ants
Dialogue: The army's returned!  Our brave boys are back!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: It looks like only one soldier made it back!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Poor Z -- I should never have let you go!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: ONE TO NOTHING!  WE WIN!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Damn, I'm proud of you, boy.  I wish I had a hundred ants of your caliber. The world would tremble.  Now, time for some R and R.  You're invited to the royal victory party!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Of course.  The entire royal family will be there to honor you.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Wait a minute, that's no soldier -- that's Z!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Z?  Our Z?  The little guy made it!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Son, you're an ant after my own heart.  A warrior.  An ant that looks death right in the face and laughs.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Well she better -- she's engaged to one.  Me!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Affirmative.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: In love?  I'm just a plain old soldier at heart.  I'll tell you what I love -- the field -- blood -- death -- orders...and the company of other warriors.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Yes, and do you know why there's a food shortage?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Negatory.  Too many ants.  And while we soldiers go out there, and fight, and bleed, and die for the colony, the namby-pamby workers live it up back home.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: I tell you son, sometimes, at night, I see myself in battle, fighting a horrible, faceless enemy, with the future of our whole species at stake. And always, the dream ends with each of us plunging his sword into the other's heart...

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Who cares?  They're workers!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You're the hero of the recent termite campaign, aren't you?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm Princess Bala.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: All these parties are so marvellously alike.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: They should be...  But there's something funny about that soldier.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: May I cut in?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: No, General.  I'm dancing with the war hero.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You dance...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: No weirdly...You remind me of someone...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: He was swarthy...primitive... earthy...sensual.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: He was a worker.  I danced with him at a worker's bar just the other day. I'm not shocking you, am I?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: OH MY GOD, IT'S YOU!  YOU'RE A WORKER!!!  A filthy, stupid, disgusting WORKER!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I CAN'T DANCE WITH A WORKER!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Quiet -- sshhh!!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: SSHH!!!  SSHH!!!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: What's this?  A worker has been masquerading as a war hero?!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: ARREST HIM!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Oh my god!  He's taking her hostage!

Speaker: princess
Dialogue: This is thoroughly unacceptable!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm coming!  I'm coming!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm going!  I'm going'

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: What was that thing?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I order you to find out where we are!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Climb up that tree and get a better view!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I've been kidnapped by the village idiot.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: How dare you speak to me like that? I'm the Princess!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Of course!  It defines society!  To deny the precept is to say that order is an arbitrary distinction applied by the society itself!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: No!  There's no such thing as "just two ants."  You never see just two ants -- you see a million ants!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I -- hate -- you.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Ha!  Don't make me laugh.  You're crazy about me!  That's why you lied and cheated to get near me!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I was slumming it!  I danced with you because you were the most pathetic specimen in the place!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I didn't choose him.  What kind  of idiot would...  ...choose who she wanted to marry?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Now, worker, you shall take me back to the colony, and have your head cut off and stuck on a sharp pole!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Insectopia?  You stupid worker, that's just a fairy tale!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Worker!  Come back here now!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: That's not a name!  That's just a letter!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z?  Z?  Wait for me!!!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: I tell ya, I'm gettin' sick of bein' yelled at.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: You know, you're not just workers -- you can be whatever you want to be! Look at Z!  He started as a worker -- then he became a soldier!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: That's right!  He slaughtered hundreds of termites single-handedly!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Well, because he's more than a worker...he's a...what did he call it, Azteca...

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Invisible!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: No -- an individual!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Well, it's...someone with his own point of view...someone who does what he wants, not whatever he's told to do!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Someone who follows his heart!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Right...because every ant's important!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: We can all be individuals!  Just like Z!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Water...water...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: My skin's dry, my exoskeleton is cracking...I wish I'd never met you, you ruined my life.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: We're going to die!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Why didn't I listen to my mother ...why'd I have to go looking for trouble? Any ant would have given their left legs to be in my position...what's wrong with me?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Wait, I hear something!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: WATER!!!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Cut me down a soft leaf so I can take a nap.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Out here I'm just what?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Stop fooling around in there.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Let me go!!!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I'm going to be rescued soon.  I'm going to be rescued soon.  I'm going to be rescued soon.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: General Formica won't let me die out here.  I'm his fiancee.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Five thousand three hundred and ninety -- no.  About five thousand four hundred by now.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Well...no, but --

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Well...I am the oldest.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: By three seconds...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You're right.  There are as many Princesses...as there are blades of grass.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Dammit, this tunnel is priority A-1! We can't afford any delays on this project!

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: I've never seen anything like it, General, they're they're...well, look!

Speaker: worker ants
Dialogue: Z!  Z!  Z!  Z!

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: Where do ya think you're going?  Get back to work!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Notice the big one, holding hands with the female?

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Well, uh, who notices workers, sir?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: No one should have to.  Have him brought to me.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: So this Z...he fancies himself an individual?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Yeah...I mean...well...I don't know, really, sir.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Well now you haven't fallen for this silly idea of individuality, have you?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Oh, no, sir!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Good.  You're a good soldier.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: So tell me.  Where's Z?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: I...I have no idea, sir.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Okay, son.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: We know what makes an ant colony strong, don't we?  We know that no ant can be an individual.  No single ant matters, right?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: That's correct, sir!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Or that one.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: No, sir!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Or that one?  Her life doesn't matter, does it?

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Don't tell that tightass anything, Weaver!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Wait!  Just let her go!  Z's long gone anyway, following some golden egg to Insectopia!  You'll never catch him!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Insectopia, hunh?...See why individuality is so dangerous?  It can always be used against you.  If this sissy here wants to dig, he'll dig.  Send them both back to the tunnel project.  Double their workload.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: What do we have on this "Insectopia"?

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Scattered reports, sir.  Rumors. Nothing reliable.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Desperate times call for desperate measures.  Get me Ant Team Six.

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Ant Team Six...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: I swear, we've passed this blade of grass three times.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Face it, Z, we're lost!  We must have walked halfway across the world by now!  How did I get into this mess...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: What difference does it make...we're both going to starve to death, or get squished, or set on fire...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z, it's beautiful!

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: You down there, haven't you ever been to a picnic?

Speaker: female wasp
Dialogue: Habla Ingles?  Well I really don't know who they are.

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Poopsie, we know some ants, don't we?  Are you related to the Fifth Avenue ants?

Speaker: female wasp
Dialogue: Darling, do you have to talk to any insect from off the street?

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Just being friendly, Poopsie.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Hello?  I'm not just "any insect". My mother is the Queen.  I'm Princess Bala!

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: They're Eurotrash, dear.

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Lunch!  A little piece of advice, sport -- bob and weave!  Bob and weave!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Well -- like my father used to say -- there's no such thing as a free meal!

Speaker: the wasps
Dialogue: Excuse me -- I'll have some potato salad -- thank-you! -- don't mind if I do!  After you!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Oh...my...God.

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Muffy!  Muffy!  Wake up!

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: WHYYYYYYYYYYYYY????

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: MMMffllmmm...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!  Help me!!!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!!!  Get me out of heeeeere!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!!!!!!!  I'm stuck!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!  You're here!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z...if we don't make it...I just want you to know....

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: This is all your fault!!!

Speaker: major mandible
Dialogue: And don't come back, you sissy!

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Talk to me.

Speaker: commando ant
Dialogue: Z and the Princess were here, sir. Signs of a struggle.

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Let's get a read on that feremone track.

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Bala...find Bala...

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Nnononononononoyeahyeahnononononono no...

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Z -- you dirt-digging, fancy-dancing, wisecracking, royalty-grabbing, rebel SCUM!  I AM COMING FOR YOU!  YOU ARE ONE DEAD ANT, MISTER!

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Let's MOVE!  GO, people!  GO!  GO! GO!  GO!  GO!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Come on, Z.

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: What's with the bummer attitude?

Speaker: butterfly
Dialogue: Yeah -- nobody stresses out in Insectopia!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Did you say...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z, we made it!

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: C'mon in!  The nectar's fine!

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: Hey, take it easy!  There's nothin' to be afraid of!

Speaker: cricket
Dialogue: Dude, here in Insectopia, we don't judge people by how many arms and legs we've got.

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: Yeah, back home, they called me a fruitfly.  But here, I'm known as...  Superfly.

Speaker: cricket
Dialogue: Anyway, big Gus is mellow.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Just looking for fun, adventure, trouble, I guess.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: You held onto this all that time?

Speaker: beetle
Dialogue: Hey Z!

Speaker: beetle
Dialogue: Wanna bring back dessert?  There's a thirty foot long blimp in the next can, made completely of chocolate!

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Yesyesyesyesyes --

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Talk to me.

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Let's move in.

Speaker: cricket
Dialogue: What if, like...we're just these tiny little things, and we're just like part of this whole other huge universe, that's like, so big we don't even know it exists?

Speaker: ladybug
Dialogue: Man...that's so deep...

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: EVERYBODY DOWN!

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Alright, you hippy scum!  Make one move and I'll exterminate you!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Stop!  You don't understand!

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: I don't have to understand, Missy -- I've got orders.  Now where's Z?

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: Man, your girl is fly, know what I'm saying?

Speaker: ladybug
Dialogue: Bala's been kidnapped!  Some flying ants took her back to the colony!

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: I know what it's like to lose someone...I keep hearing the sound of Muffy's flapping wings...so I'll take you.

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: Geez.  I feel like a real stinkbug.

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Sorry.  Turbulence.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Princess Bala.  Good.  Where's Z?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: He's...he's dead.  You don't have to look for him anymore.  He was eaten by a praying mantis.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: It's a shame he died prematurely...I was hoping to kill him myself.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Well you'll never be able to hurt him where he is now.  I miss him already.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: You miss him?  Why?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Because...because he's twice the ant that you are.  I could never go through with marrying you.  I'm -- I'm an individual, and when I get married, it'll be to someone I choose.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Princess Bala, I'm just a simple old soldier, and the ways of the feminine mind are a little too complex for me. But one thing I do know is, there are more Princesses where you came from. I just hope they're not all like you. In the meantime, maybe we can arrange for you to see Z again after all.

Speaker: male wasp
Dialogue: Good luck, Z.  For a wingless insect, you're alright by me.

Speaker: soldier ant
Dialogue: You there!  Worker!

Speaker: soldier ant
Dialogue: What are you doing out here!  All workers are to remain inside the colony, by orders of General Formica!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Very impressive, General.

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Wave that flag, you maggot!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Is there anything wrong, your majesty?

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: It's just...How I miss Bala.  I wish she were here for this special moment.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: She is, your majesty.  She is.

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Z!  Z!  I smell Z!

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Bala!  Yeahyeahyeahyeahyeah!  Find Bala!  Yeahyeahyeahyeah!

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Yeahyeahyeahyeahyeahyeahyeah...

Speaker: tracker ant
Dialogue: Bala...Yeahyeahyeahyeahyeahyeah...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!  You came back!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: There's something going on, Z --

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: They're having a ceremony to open the Megatunnel...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Oh no...

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!  what are you doing?

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z!!! Wait for me!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Your majesty, I'm afraid matters of state keep me from attending the ceremony.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: But General -- this tunnel is your baby!  You're sure you can't stay ?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: 'Fraid not, your majesty.  Goodbye, your majesty.

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Very well, General -- I know you -- all work and no play!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Alright, let's move out!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: In the name of the colony, I declare this tunnel open!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Bala!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Mom!

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Yes he is.

Speaker: workers
Dialogue: Hey...it is Z...listen to what he says! [etc].

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: Z...I'm so sorry!  I --

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: Oh...it's that social-climbing worker again -- what does he want?

Speaker: mandible
Dialogue: Let 'er rip!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: Listen!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: You there!  Stop!  I say!

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: There's no way out!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: We're all going to drown!!!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: Z...what can we do?

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: You heard the ant -- DIG!!!

Speaker: worker
Dialogue: He did it!  Z!  Z!  Z!  Z!  Z!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Z.  I should have known.  All that work, all that preparation, come to nothing.  All because of one stinking ant.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: ALRIGHT.  WHICH ONE OF YOU IS Z?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: WHAT ARE YOU, DEAF?  I ASKED YOU, WHERE'S Z?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Folks, you may have survived that flood, but there's no way you're gonna escape from me.  I'll make you a deal.  Hand over the rebel leader Z, and you survive.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: But if you don't hand him over, you're all going to die, each and every single..."individual" one of you.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: What shall it be, workers?

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Have it your way.

Speaker: weaver
Dialogue: No, I'm Z.

Speaker: azteca
Dialogue: I'm Z!

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: No, I'm Z.

Speaker: workers
Dialogue: I'm Z!  I'm Z!  I'm Z and so is my brother!  I've been Z for weeks now!

Speaker: queen
Dialogue: We are Z.

Speaker: all
Dialogue: I am Z!  I am Z!  I am Z!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: ATTACK!

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: Hey, guys!

Speaker: wasp
Dialogue: It's them!

Speaker: wasp
Dialogue: Are these hooligans giving you trouble, Z?

Speaker: fly
Dialogue: Say the word, Z, and we kick their butts.

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: What are you doing?!  ATTACK!!  Don't just stand there, Carpenter! Make an example of yourself!

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Uh, actually, we are outnumbered sir...

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: AHHHHHHH!!

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: Please...I...I can't swim...Help me...

Speaker: formica
Dialogue: I guess it does...to the ant.

Speaker: carpenter
Dialogue: Sir, if it's any consolation, I still think you're completely worthless as an individual.

Speaker: bala
Dialogue: A few?
